sentences.en: A cynic is a man who knows the price of everything and the value of nothing.
sentences.cn: 玩世不恭者是知道一切事物的价格,却不知道任何东西的价值的人.

sentences.en: A cynic is a man who knows the price of everything and the value of nothing.
sentences.cn: 玩世不恭者,是只知一切事物的价钱而不只其价值的人.

sentences.en: A cynic is a man who, when he smell flower, looks around for a coffin.
sentences.cn: 好冷嘲人生者,是个当他闻到花香之时就会四处找寻棺材的人.

sentences.en: A cynic might list this as a form of economic aid for Allende.
sentences.cn: 想挖苦人的人可以把这些都说成是给予阿连德的某种形式的经援.

sentences.en: A cynic might say this is political posturing.
sentences.cn: 愤世嫉俗者大概会说,这不过是政治上的惺惺作态.

sentences.en: Become a white - collar or a cynic.
sentences.cn: 不想做 白领,就做愤青吧.

sentences.en: Coverdale is something of a professional cynic.
sentences.cn: 科弗代尔有些象个专事嘲讽的恨世者.

sentences.en: Cynic is the member of a sect of ancient Greek philosophers.
sentences.cn: 犬儒学派是古代希腊哲学学派的成员.

sentences.en: Cynic: blackguard whose faulty vision sees things as they are, not as they ought to be.
sentences.cn: 愤世嫉俗者: 一介鄙夫,他的有缺陷的视力,只看到他想看的东西, 而不是它们应该的样子.

sentences.en: Even hardened cynics believe the meeting is a step towards peace.
sentences.cn: 就连最顽固的愤世嫉俗者也认为这次会议向和平迈出了一步。

sentences.en: Even the cynic, the girl stood up, abandoned the cow and walked away.
sentences.cn: 就连这个愤世嫉俗的女孩也站起身来, 抛下奶牛走了.

sentences.en: I have come to be very much of a cynic in these matters.
sentences.cn: 在这些事上我变得相当愤世嫉俗。

sentences.en: It would take a special kind of cynic not to be impressed by the results.
sentences.cn: 想不被这样的成就影响,你需要有着格外愤世嫉俗的精神.

sentences.en: The cynic puts all human actions into two classes: openly bad and secretly bad.
sentences.cn: 愤世嫉俗者把所有人类的行为分为两等: 公开的坏和秘密的坏.

sentences.en: The philosopher replied rather contemptuously , I am Diogenes , the Cynic.
sentences.cn: 哲学家相当傲慢地回答说:“我是 提奥奇尼斯 --犬儒学者. ”

sentences.en: What is a cynic? A man who knows the price of and the value of nothing.
sentences.cn: 什么是愤世嫉俗者? 就是那种对价格一清二楚,却对价值毫无所知的人.

words.tran_cn: 玩世不恭，愤世嫉俗；犬儒主义；冷嘲热讽
愤世嫉俗的人,玩世不恭的人

trans.tran_cn: 愤世嫉俗者，认为人皆自私的人，悲观者，怀疑者
trans.tran_en: someone who is not willing to believe that people have good, honest, or sincere reasons for doing something
